intro: Microcos sinuata, commonly known as the narrowleaf microcos, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its showy flowers are typically pink or purple with five petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Microcos sinuata is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
